Row.Text: Attack with your city!

Liberating a city will return it to one of their previous owners, possibly bringing that civilization back into the game.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{1_WarmongerInfo}
Liberating a city provides a [COLOR_MEDIUM_GREEN]SEVERE REDUCTION[ENDCOLOR] to previously earned warmonger penalties.
Keep this city in your empire for now. It will be a less productive, occupied city until its post-war ownership is discussed at the peace table.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{1_WarmongerInfo}
Keep this city in your empire.
Warmonger penalty for keeping this city now is: {1_WarmongerLevel}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Penalty will be either refunded or doubled at the end of the war depending on whether or not you keep the city.

Warmonger penalty for keeping a player's final city is based on the Surprise War penalty for this era. This value is [COLOR_RED]DOUBLED[ENDCOLOR] if capturing this city eliminates a major civilization (not a city state).
Raze city clearing it and all its districts and buildings from the map. This option must be chosen the turn the city is conquered.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{1_WarmongerInfo}
[COLOR_RED]Razing a city may give you a serious Warmonger penalty![ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Warmonger penalty for razing this city now is: {1_WarmongerLevel}
Warmonger penalty is [COLOR_RED]TRIPLE[ENDCOLOR] the Formal War penalty for this era when you raze a player's final city.
You cannot raze a major civilization's original capital or a city that you or an ally founded or owned at the start of this war.
Liberate to Founder ({1_CivName})
Liberate to Pre-War Owner ({1_CivName})
Keep City
Raze City
